publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5091 Johann Lamont: Living Wage—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow City Council on the success of the Glasgow Living Wage campaign; notes that already more than 100 companies have followed the lead of Scotland’s largest local authority and signed up to a policy guaranteeing all employees a wage of at least £7 per hour, and urges all local authorities to consider launching living wage campaigns.

S3M-5091 Johann Lamont: Living Wage—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow City Council on the success of the Glasgow Living Wage campaign; notes that already more than 100 companies have followed the lead of Scotland’s largest local authority and signed up to a policy guaranteeing all employees a wage of at least £7 per hour, and urges all local authorities to consider launching living wage campaigns.

S3M-5091 Living Wage (lodged on 29 October 2009) Cathy Peattie*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Cathy Jamieson*, Patricia Ferguson*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Karen Gillon*, James Kelly*, Michael McMahon*, Claire Baker*, Trish Godman*, John Park*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Patrick Harvie*, Marlyn Glen*, Robert Brown*, Elaine Smith*, Des McNulty*
S3M-5091 Living Wage (lodged on 29 October 2009) Sandra White*, George Foulkes*, Hugh Henry*, Elaine Murray*
S3M-5091 Living Wage (lodged on 29 October 2009) Pauline McNeill*
S3M-5091 Living Wage (lodged on 29 October 2009) Sarah Boyack*
S3M-5091 Living Wage (lodged on 29 October 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-5091 Living Wage (lodged on 29 October 2009) Rhoda Grant*
